author: fideliaayaabilla14gmail.com2
title: Cardano Ladies Hub (CLH)
description: Women at the University of Cape Coast want to learn and contribute to the blockchain ecosystem but do not have the means to do that. The Cardano lady's Hub will offer them the environment to do that.

f6_assessments.q0:
A very comprehensive proposal, perhaps a bit overly comprehensive. Please do note PA's go through hundreds of proposals and might not be as patient as others. Word of advice to the proposer, to please make your proposal more concise. Perhaps attending/refreshing the teachings of Catalyst School. Besides that, the intent of this proposer is amazing. Which is to onboard more women on to blockchain, in this case Cardano.

Cardano is very much dominated by men. Equal education and opportunity should also be open to women to provide a different perspective and solutions on blockchain issues. This hub for ladies I can actually imagine it being exported to various regions, having a safe space specifically for women to support each other and feel comfortable in is very sought out.

Besides the importance of empowering women to be more involved in the Cardano blockchain sphere, education in general on Cardano is essential.
f6_assessments.q1:
The solution deducted from the problem statement is a bit off. The proposers mention there keywords "want to learn and contribute" and that doesn't actually need to involve a physical space. Catalyst community has been thriving under covid restricted circumstances, though there are indeed merit to having a physical hub.

Seeing that there seems to be a lot of anticipation towards the universities acceptance of having a physical hub and what this hub will be representing, add to that the identification of initial interest into learning about blockchain seems still low, I would actually recommend the proposer to continue their workshops first.

In the very beginning of this proposal, the proposers mention that they have been doing workshops and have been achieving small successes by onboarding new PA's from their university. So build on that first, educate more students, educate the dean and the upper echelons, educate the local government and then setup a physical hub.

Therefore it lessens the burden of achieving the goals of this proposal and at the same time being more effective. For, the proposer would have done the initial groundwork of building a community.
f6_assessments.q2:
The structure of the core delivery or the main make-up of a proposal is quite well done. Their effort to mitigate potential risk and their roadmap is very extensive. You can clearly see what will be done continuously, there is very little gap for self imagination which in turns means high transparency and potentially high auditability. 

Although high transparency also opens the proposer to higher scrutiny, and there is one major critique, there is a lot of emphasis on creating a physical hub rather than creating an engaging education syllabus/equivalent. Hence as previously mentioned above, between the headline of this proposal,the identified problem and the solution does not correlate well with one another.

It is very much a proposal that can be audited easily but at the same token it exposes some flaws. If not funded, please do not be discouraged, as mentioned, please find a balance between setting up a physical hub and actually creating a ecosystem that is conducive in learning effectively how to build on top of and to contribute in Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: Geographically, Cape Coast is a city in Ghana, Ghana is a country in West Africa, and in Africa. The University of Cape Coast is full of women who want to learn and contribute to Blockchain, but don't have the means to do so. The Cardano Women's Center will provide them with the environment to do just that. To do that, the team proposed the idea of ​​renting a space used as a hub for the purpose of training women at the University of Cape Coast in Blockchain technology, in order to scale up and boost the number of women in the community. Cardano ecosystem. Proposal impacts the challenge and is described in detail. The author of the proposal researched, interviewed women and most of them did not know about Cardano and any cryptocurrency. When taking into account the population of the African Continent, one can see that women are in the majority and these women because of their lack of this knowledge in the blockchain has resulted in a less likely growth of Cardano Africa. . Therefore, when fund 9 was launched, the author found it necessary to apply for some funding to establish a women-centered center at the University of Cape Coast. Help educate and train them to be part of an ever-growing ecosystem. and remove misconceptions about Blockchain and cryptocurrencies. Besides, the author of the proposal also recognizes the possible risks. At the same time, there are solutions to minimize risks when the proposal is implemented
f6_assessments.q1: The author created a 3-month plan to implement a very specific proposal. About the route. The author has arranged the work to be done in the project with a detailed timetable. The author details: Topic of the discussion, Expected outcome of the meeting, Topics to be taught, Activities to be carried out. The author presents each job and is explained in detail, in a specific time and space. We know how, when, where all the work needs to be done... Next is the budget. The proposal requires a budget of $15,500. This is a fairly fair and reasonable range of requirements. The author also created a table showing the budgets allocated to each job accurately and explained in depth. We know how the funding will be used and for what. Finally, about the core team members. We learned that the group had 3 members and was presented with a short text introducing each member. We know who they are, their skills and experience. Mohammed Mustapha is: a central leader at WADA, running a private cryptocurrency and Fintech solutions, he organized 4 Cardano meetups with over 300 attendees in Ghana... and has attached a link profile to help us understand more about the background of his work history, increasing confidence in the abilities presented by the proposal. Overall, the proposal's plan is very good, detailed roadmap, transparent budget and skilled and experienced members increase the sustainable feasibility of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is completely new, however, the proposal's plan is very good. Prove that the author has the ability to carry out the project successfully. Detailed roadmap, detailed budget. Make it easy for us to track project progress. The author also provides many KPIs that make it easy for us to audit transparently and continuously. Regarding the expected end product, the success of this proposal. I believe complete and satisfactory information has been established. Because the author gave us a lot of information. We know what it takes to get to the end result. Proposal has good auditability. If the proposal is successful and properly developed, it will be a new gateway to the growth of University of Cape Coast women, African women and the Cardano ecosystem. Ensure gender equality, help them understand the ecosystem, remove misconceptions about Blockchain and cryptocurrencies...

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers have provided a detailed assessment of how this project is going to impact on the Cardano/Catalyst community and grow women adoption to blockchain technolog. The promoters have targeted women on university campuses with particular emphasis on University of Cape Coast (Ghana). They also hope to scale up this project by targeting other universities. The project when fully implemented on the University will provide a permanent location on campus where women and even men can both access materials on Cardano/Catalyst project. Also, having a permanent meeting place will enable the women to meet and ideate, draw experts’ knowledge on blockchain technology and share knowledge on projects that will grow the Cardano/Catalyst community in Ghanaian university campuses and Africa at large. The promoters also hope to guide the women to become developers, entrepreneurs and trainers of blockchain technology with a target of 30 high skilled women to be on boarded on Yoroi Wallet, Idea Scale and as PA. Aside the physical space that the promoters are sourcing fund for, it is important they adopt online meetings, social media platforms and other town-hall meetings to grow the numbers on the Cape Coast University (Ghana) and other universities they hope to target in the future. Finally, the proposer have envisage the potential risks that will affect the implementation of the project and have put in the necessary measures to mitigate these risks on the university campus especially removing the misconception about blockchain technology among the university authorities by using faculty members who are already using blockchain technology.
f6_assessments.q1: The promoters of the project have provided detailed roadmap to execute the project in three month. This roadmap includes a detailed itinerary on how the project is going to be implemented successfully. The success of this project largely depends on how the promoters will be able to get along the university authority as well as be able to demystify the erroneous perception women have on blockchain technology and the Catalyst project at large. To implement this project successfully, the promoters have outline measures they are going to implement to get the university authorities along by introducing the benefits that blockchain technology and the Catalyst project brings to the university community. This includes creating employment for the women through projects development on blockchain, empowering the women to pick up entrepreneurial skills through the Cardano/Catalyst project and also exposing them to the benefits they stand to enjoy from the community as they become members. Again the success of the project depends on how the promoters will enroll these women unto the catalyst project and sign them on the various activities of Cardano. The proposer have outline in this proposal measures to achieve this by targeting these women through face-to-face meetings, radio advertising campaigns on the University campuses, using the rented space as a training hub and organizing online meetings for these women. Finally the budgetary request under this project is feasible to ensure the successful implementation of the various aspects of this project. However, the promoters should adjust the miscellaneous expenses to include internet cost as it will be needed to ensure online training for the women who will join online.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers have provided some plan on how this project could be audited and accounted for. Among the things the project hope to deliver is to graduate participants from the various training programs that the proposers are going to offer under this project based on their performance and interest. Again, they hope to set-up the office space with three months as per the outlined project implantation roadmap. However, it is important they promoters look at including in this proposal how they hope to share the outcome of this project to the Cardano/Catalyst community. They also have to give the channels by which they will communicate the success of this project. For example through Youtube links, Cardano platforms, through town hall meetings etc. They should also provide a detailed profile on the team that are going to work on the project and the role each member will play in the various stages of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: Having a physical space can help this team of entrepreneurs to concrete the educating and training program they designed targeted to drawing in women into the Cardano blockchain universe. Cardano Ladies Hub in Cape Town will empower young female entrepreneurs and inspire them into blockchain technology studies. Women suffer from several different cultural barriers at the time of studying technology and scientific driven disciplines. We are not usually interested in this kind of knowledge because it seems to be so alien from the real world. Having a physical space where real things happen, with real people working, preferently other women, could be a great starting point to drawing interest and engagement in this fascinating universe. Cardano blockchain can give them real opportunities of monetary empowerment. This might be really inspiring for them to share with really low-income women and be leaders of social and economic projects that help less benefited women to liberate and achieve economic independence also. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Having both a Cape Town University student and a Wada leader is a guarantee of this team knowing its field of work and the concrete challenges and necessities ahead in order to implement the proposal successfully. Key milestones designed in a very professional plan are well developed and already decided and designed. Budget breakdown is consistent and clear. This team first experience in Catalyst funding will give them the experience they will need in order to continuously work on their challenges and goals. Educating Ghanian young women in Cardano blockchain can be a super powerful weapon for empowering themselves and really changing their lives and communities. Given experience and the plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes, information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal. Monthly reports of every kind of progress will be efficiently communicated by members of the team. Even Though it is not specified, knowing a Wada leader is on the boat, they will find the correct communication channels for sharing with the whole of Cardano Community the hopeful advances this team will surely make. Educating and empowering women with knowledge and opportunities is the best kind of investment the Cardano Community can surely make as women are the real key element to transform African society and culture.

solution: Rent a space to be used as a hub for the sole purpose of training women at the University of Cape Coast in blockchain technologies to scale up and push the number of women in the Cardano ecosystem.
